meanings.definition: An action or event serving as an introduction to something more important.
meanings.sent1: The preludes to the main event got everyone excited.
meanings.sent2: The preludes to the big announcement were full of anticipation.
meanings.sent3: The preludes to the surprise party were carefully planned.
meanings.sent4: The preludes to success often involve hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The preludes to the adventure set the stage for an unforgettable journey.

meanings.definition: A short piece of music that acts as an introduction to a longer piece.
meanings.sent1: The pianist played beautiful preludes before the main performance.
meanings.sent2: The preludes by the orchestra set the mood for the entire concert.
meanings.sent3: The preludes by the band were so catchy, they stuck in my head all day.
meanings.sent4: The preludes of the symphony danced through the air like colorful butterflies.
meanings.sent5: The preludes of the opera were hauntingly melodic, captivating the audience instantly.
